main_definition: To reduce the price or value of something, often due to a special offer or perceived decrease in worth.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to a reduced price offered on items as part of a promotion or sale
meanings_and_examples.example: The store was offering 20% off all clothing during the weekend, so I bought my new shirt at a discounted price.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In finance, it can refer to a reduced interest rate offered on loans or credit
meanings_and_examples.example: As part of her financial planning, Emily decided to consolidate her debts and secure a lower interest rate through discounted loan options.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicates an adjustment in value due to decreased worth or perceived lack of quality
meanings_and_examples.example: The antique vase I purchased was heavily discounted because it had a small crack, indicating reduced value.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In investments, it can refer to the reduction in price due to market fluctuations or changes in perceived worth
meanings_and_examples.example: The company's stock took a hit overnight and was trading at significantly discounted prices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give less importance to something, often by relegating it to the background or lower priority
meanings_and_examples.example: In planning our family budget, we decided to discount travel expenses for this year in favor of saving money on necessities.
